# TESS Program G04186

Title: Stellar Flare Pulsations: Utilizing High Cadence TESS Data To Study The Solar-Stellar Flare Connection

PI: Inglis, Andrew - Catholic University Of America

Type: SMALL

Summary: Solar and stellar flares often show pulsations and oscillatory signatures in their emission, collectively known as quasi- periodic oscillations (QPOs). This phenomenon is closely linked to flare energy release. TESS' new 20s cadence mode is a step-change in capability and provides a new unique opportunity to detect and analyze such pulsations. We will analyze flares from a set of active M-dwarf stars and address the following questions: 1. What is the prevalence of QPO signatures in stellar flares, and how do they depend on source star properties? 2. Do stellar QPOs display the same relationships with the host flare as their solar counterparts? 3. Is there consistent scaling between solar and stellar QPOs? 4. Can we use QPO signatures to perform stellar coronal seismology?
